definition: to hesitate/indecisive
to pace back and forth/to hesitate/to waver
to hesitate
(negative prefix)/not/no
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: No good is ever done in this world by hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 在这世界上踌躇不决成绩不了任何事。

sentences.english: Don't falter in your resolve, or you will miss the chance in a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 别再踌躇不决了，否则你会错过这次良机。

sentences.english: She wavered between going and staying .
sentences.chinese: 她对于去和留踌躇不决。

sentences.english: The banks balked, so Bair went public.
sentences.chinese: 银行却踌躇不决，于是，拜尔决定将此事公开。

sentences.english: I'm stumbling at this step and can't make a move.
sentences.chinese: 我对这一步骤踌躇不决，没能往前迈。

definition: to hesitate over what move to make (idiom); to waver/to shilly-shally
to hesitate to move forward/to hesitate/to hold back
hesitancy/indecision/to waver
variant of 踟躕|踟蹰[chi2 chu2]
to hesitate
to hesitate
hesitant to take action
to waver/to hesitate
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
to oscillate without pause (idiom)/to fluctuate/(of thoughts) to wander/to waver
to tread/to tramp/to loiter/to hover around
at a loss (idiom)
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
indecisive/wavering
